reviewsJson.markdown:
**RTA/ Kayfun 5**

**% Used/ 2 drops per 10ml or roughly 0.4%**

**Coil/ Single W/ 30** 

**Steep Time/3 days Wicking/ Full**

**PG/VG 50/50 Nic% 0**

**Mouth Feel** - Smooth with moderate mouth feel. Slight creaminess.

**Flavor Properties**- Robust strong coffee notes with a rich caramel undertones. This has an almost charcoal-roast bean taste to it.

**Relatable Flavors** - Like taking a sip of your favourite Starbuck's Caramel Cappuccino. 

**Off Flavors** - This is a very potent flavor. Rule of thumb is 1 or 2 drops per 10ml. For me, I like my coffee strong with extra shots. So I went with 2 drops and it didn't impart any burnt taste like other coffee flavorings.

**Position In The Recipe** - This is one of those flavours that could work as a base in small respectable amounts. You could totally make a smooth, creamy caramel cappuccino (refer to recipe below)

**Pairings** - cream, tobacco, bakery, cakes

**End notes** - If you like coffee, you will like this. This flavoring gets a lot of shit because people use it at absurb percentages. It's a really potent flavoring that can be tamed with creams and vanillas to produce a really tasty coffee vape. I urge you guys to try it out if you are a fan of robust coffees. I definitely consider this one of, if not the best TFA coffee flavoring out there!

Additional recipe courtesy of Vapor Trails NW:

**Kool Beans!**

2 drops Caramel Cappuccino (TFA)

3% Vanilla Swirl (TFA)

3% Sweet Cream (TFA)

2% Caramel Candy (TFA)

3 drops per 10 ml Koolada
reviewsJson.author: thedirtyprojector
reviewsJson.title: Caramel Cappucino
